Albania: Hoxha selected Ramiz Alia as the next party head, bypassing Mehmet Shehu.
Australia: Baby Azaria Chamberlain disappears from a campsite at Uluru (Ayers Rock), reportedly taken by a dingo. 1980 Australian federal election: The Coalition is elected.
Brazil: Mauro Milhomem, a pilot, attempted to crash his Sertanejo-721 into the Hotel Presidente owned by his mother-in-law, after he had an argument with his wife the previous day after he discovered that she cheated him. The plane failed to hit the target and hit into several objects and ultimately crashed into an accounting office in front to a forum. Six people were killed and four were wounded. Pope John Paul II visits Brazil; 7 people are crushed to death in a crowd meeting him.
Canada: A referendum on Quebec independence is held, resulting in a majority (59.56%) of the province voting to remain in Canada.
Chile: The military government promulgates the Chilean Constitution of 1980, which is adopted by plebiscite. Economic policy begins to be significantly influenced by the ideas of the Chicago School and of Neoliberalism. The United States oblige President of the Philippines Ferdinand Marcos to cancel a scheduled visit by President Pinochet to the Philippines.
Colombia:
Dominican embassy siege
Serial killer Pedro López a.k.a. Monster of the Andes confessed to over 300 murders
Cuba:
The Mariel Boatlift. Cuban authorities allow up to 125,000 people to depart Cuba by boat from Mariel harbor for the U.S. The Cuban and U.S. governments agree to halt the exodus in October.
U.S. President Jimmy Carter orders the U.S. Justice Department to expel any Cubans who committed "serious crimes" in Cuba.
Estonia: Youth riots in the capital of the Soviet Republic of Estonia were quickly forced down.
Haiti: President for Life Jean-Claude Duvalier marries Michèle Bennett
India: Indira Gandhi returns to power heading the Congress party splinter group, Congress (Indira).
Indinesia: The Petition of Fifty—a statement of concern to parliament about the use of government power, propaganda, and presidential personality cult—is begun.
Israel:
The old Israeli shekel replaced the Israeli pound as the currency of Israel.
The Knesset passed the Jerusalem Law, asserting that Jerusalem was and would remain the undivided capital of Israel.
Italy: Umberto Eco publishes The Name of the Rose, a medieval murder mystery. Ustica Massacre: a DC-9 operated by Itavia crashes into the Tyrrhenian Sea between Ponza and Ustica, killing all 81 people on board. The disaster led to numerous investigations, legal actions, and accusations, and continues to be a source of speculation, including claims of conspiracy by the Italian government and others. Bologna massacre: a terrorist bombing of the Central Station at Bologna kills 85 people and wounds more than 200. This was found to be a neo-fascist bombing, mainly organized by the Nuclei Armati Rivoluzionari: Francesca Mambro and Valerio Fioravanti were sentenced to life imprisonment. In April 2007 the Supreme Court confirmed the conviction of Luigi Ciavardini, a NAR member associated closely with close ties to Terza Posizione. Ciavardini received a 30-year prison sentence for his role in the attack. Broadcaster Canale 5 starts to broadcast on a national scale. This is the first national private television. Irpinia earthquake, took place in Southern Italy with a moment magnitude of 6.9 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme). The shock was centered on the village of Conza and left at least 2,483 people dead, at least 7,700 injured, and left 250,000 homeless.
Japan: Japan became the biggest motor vehicle producing country in the world with 11,042,884 motor vehicles compared to the USA's 8,009,841.
Nepal: Constitutional referendum follows agitation for reform. Small majority favours keeping existing panchayat system. King agrees to allow direct elections to national assembly – but on a non-party basis.
Philippine: The Philippines' first local elections under the martial law era is held amid wide boycotts. MV Don Juan and oil tanker MT Tacloban City collide in Tablas Strait off Mindoro, killing 176. Kilusang Mayo Uno (KMU) organized Pres. Marcos allows Ninoy Aquino to flee to the U.S. for his medical treatment.
Poland:
Gdańsk Agreement
LOT Polish Airlines Flight 007
21 demands of MKS
Russia:
Andrei Sakharov is exiled without charges to the closed industrial city of Gorki for opposing the invasion of Afghanistan.
The United States announces its planned boycott of the Moscow Olympics because of the invasion of Afghanistan.
The trade union Solidarity was founded in Poland.
The Farabundo Martí National Liberation Front (FMLN) was founded from an assortment of leftist and Communist Salvadoran revolutionary organizations.
Serbia: Croatian dictator Josip Broz Tito dies in Ljubljana at the age of 88. Ethnic tensions rise across the country.
Singapore: The PAP wins all 75 seats in the 1980 General Election.
Slovenia: Tito dies at the Ljubljana University Medical Centre.
